html:
131 U.S. 403

9 S.Ct. 793

33 L.Ed. 215

HUNT
v.
BLACKBURN.

April 8, 1889.

[Statement of Case from pages 403-405 intentionally omitted]

J. B. Heiskell, for the motion.

PER CURIAM.

1

It is ordered that the decree of this court of November 26, 1888, be made absolute against the heirs and representatives of Sallie S. Blackburn, deceased.
html_lawbox:
131 U.S. 403 (1889)

HUNT
v.
BLACKBURN.

No. 16.

Supreme Court of United States.

Submitted January 22, 1889.
Decided April 8, 1889.
ORIGINAL MOTION IN A CAUSE APPEALED FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF ARKANSAS.

*405 Mr. J.B. Heiskell, for the motion, cited.

PER CURIAM:

It is ordered that

The decree of this court of November 26, 1888, be made absolute against the heirs and representatives of Sallie S. Blackburn, deceased.
